      • setNumber

        public void setNumber​(int r,
                      int c,
                      int nbr)
        Sets the number nbr at row r, column c. Setting the number (0) is not allowed and should be handeled by clearNumber instead. Alternatively, use setOrClearNumber.
        Specified by:
        setNumber in interface SudokuSolver
        Parameters:
        r - The row
        c - The column
        nbr - The number to insert in box r, c
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if assertIsWithinBounds throws it

      • clearNumber

        public void clearNumber​(int r,
                        int c)

        Specified by:
        clearNumber in interface SudokuSolver
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if assertIsWithinBounds throws it

      • setOrClearNumber

        public void setOrClearNumber​(int r,
                             int c,
                             int nbr)
        Either sets or clears a number at row r, column c, depending on the number. Equivalent to setNumber(r, c, nbr) if nbr is not 0, else clearNumber(n, c). This is a convenience method. There comes many times when sudoku boards needs to be fully copied and the setNumber safeguard to only set valid numbers is impractical. However, when this safeguard does not need to be lifted, use setNumber instead. This makes sure that code that clears a number where it shouldn't crashes fast and early.
        Parameters:
        r - the row
        c - the column
        nbr - the number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if assertIsWithinBounds throws it

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid​(int r,
                       int c)
        Check sudoku rules for row r, column c. Bounds are checked with assertIsWithinBounds.
        Parameters:
        r - the row
        c - the column
        Returns:
        true if all sudoku rules are true for the position, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if assertIsWithinBounds throws it

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid​(int r,
                       int c,
                       int nbr)
        Check sudoku rules for row r, column c after trying to set nbr. Bounds are checked with assertIsWithinBounds. After having tried with the new number, the old number is set again, restoring the status quo.
        Specified by:
        isValid in interface SudokuSolver
        Parameters:
        r - the row
        c - the column
        nbr - the number
        Returns:
        true if all sudoku rules are true for the position after number placement, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if assertIsWithinBounds throws it

      • isAllValid

        public boolean isAllValid()
        Check sudoku rules for the entire matrix.
        Specified by:
        isAllValid in interface SudokuSolver
        Returns:
        true if all sudoku rules are true for all positions, false otherwise
